programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Hiraku won't waste his second chance at life and decides he will focus on what truly matters; he builds a new home with his own two hands.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: As the weeks turn into months, Hiraku's loneliness grows; he thought he desired a life of solitude, but his wish for companionship grows stronger by the day.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Hiraku and Lu begin their new life together, unaware of the visitors who will soon arrive.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Now that they've secured a reliable water source, they can start a rice paddy and build a bathhouse.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: With their homestead completed, they turn their focus to food preparation as winter is coming.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: A surprise attack would have shattered their peaceful lives were it not for the almighty farming tool; as word spreads, their home blooms into a village.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Hiraku realizes the importance of diplomacy when the demon lord and the dragons establish contact with the Great Tree Village.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Hiraku's offhand comment leads to a series of events that end with a merchant setting up a trade deal with The Great Tree Village.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Spurred by her followers, the demon lord's daughter attempts to invade the Great Tree Village.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: News of the impending birth thrills the villagers, but they aren't the only ones interested.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World

programme.desc: Nazuma remains frustratingly elusive, but Ko may have a nostalgic solution to this new problem.

programme.desc: As Ko reconnects with a classmate, questions arise he isn't sure he knows how to answer.

programme.desc: Three's a crowd when Ko invites Akira to hang out with him and Nazuna late one evening.

programme.title: Call of the Night

programme.title: Call of the Night
programme.desc: Ko thinks he has all the time in the world, but the revelation of an unexpected deadline changes everything; hopefully his friends have some advice.

programme.title: Call of the Night

programme.desc: A chat with a friend reveals Ko's lack of answers to some all-important questions.

programme.desc: The new club members must take turns introducing one another, causing Hana to wonder what her strengths are.

programme.title: Flower and Asura
programme.desc: Hana's enthusiasm deflates as Mr. Kichijoji readies the club for an upcoming competition; why must she want to win and why can't she just enjoy doing what she loves?

programme.title: Flower and Asura
programme.desc: A spontaneous question causes Hana to freeze during her first broadcast; it's one thing to stick to the script; improvising is a completely different story.

programme.desc: Anne is realistic, while Hanna is idealistic; disagreements are inevitable; that won't stop Hanna from trying to befriend her fellow club member.

programme.desc: It's a tight deadline, but the broadcasting club has the will to complete their submission to the original TV drama category.

programme.desc: Shura is an expert storyteller, and her ability to conjure an entire city in her audience's mind proves that Hana still has a long way to go.

programme.desc: Hana makes new friends during a recitation workshop; little does she know that one of them has a connection to Anne's past.

programme.title: Flower and Asura
programme.desc: The best way to improve one's skills; there are many answers, but no single best path.

programme.desc: After an advanced lesson on Otaku culture, Shinichi finds himself defending a foreign spy that also happens to be a wolf girl.

programme.desc: While his students adopt the otaku culture at breakneck speed, Shinichi has a sneaking suspicion that Elbia is playing both sides.

programme.desc: With the Japanese Government's true intentions clear, Shinichi must be protected from harm at all times.
